ingredients.name: Tanqueray gin
ingredients.notes: Tanqueray gin provides a crisp and dry juniper-driven taste with herbal notes.

ingredients.name: dry vermouth
ingredients.notes: Dry vermouth adds a subtle herbal and slightly bitter undertone.

ingredients.name: olive
ingredients.notes: Olive contributes a briny and savory accent.

tasting_notes.description: The DRY MARTINI offers a classic and clean flavor profile.
Juniper and herbaceous tones dominate the palate, with dry vermouth providing balance and depth.
The olive garnish introduces a savory finish that complements the gin's botanicals.
The overall drinking experience is refined and sophisticated, with a smooth mouthfeel and a lingering dryness.

ingredients.name: Tanqueray gin
ingredients.notes: Tanqueray gin provides the classic juniper and citrus notes with a slightly spicy finish.

ingredients.name: sweet vermouth
ingredients.notes: Sweet vermouth adds a rich, deep sweetness and herbal complexity.

ingredients.name: bitters
ingredients.notes: Bitters contribute a layer of spiciness and aromatic depth.

tasting_notes.description: The HANKY-PANKY offers a harmonious balance of botanicals and sweetness, creating a smooth and complex flavor experience.
The initial juniper brightness of the gin is mellowed by the rich sweetness of the sweet vermouth.
The bitters add an aromatic finish with subtle spicy undertones.
The cocktail has a full-bodied taste with a velvety mouthfeel and a lingering, warming aftertaste.

ingredients.name: Tanqueray gin
ingredients.notes: Tanqueray gin provides a strong juniper presence with slight earthy undertones.

ingredients.name: vermouth blanc
ingredients.notes: Vermouth blanc adds a sweet, floral, and herbaceous profile.

ingredients.name: Cointreau
ingredients.notes: Cointreau offers a sweet and bitter orange peel flavor.

ingredients.name: Salers Gentiane
ingredients.notes: Salers Gentiane introduces a bitter and earthy element, with a hint of herbal complexity.

tasting_notes.description: The BITTER STRIPPER is a symphony of bitterness balanced with floral and citrus notes.
The gin's juniper character anchors the cocktail while the vermouth blanc contributes sweetness and an herbal bouquet.
Cointreau's citrus bite cuts through, providing balance and complexity.
Finally, Salers Gentiane adds another layer of bitterness that lingers on the finish, creating a multifaceted drinking experience.
